Instead, they have made air travel the most difficult means of mass transit in the United States, at the same time failing to make air travel any more secure. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: blogspot.in

item.title: Protect your privacy! Learn how to protect your privacy before Google's changes take effect on March 1 | Progressive Change Campaign Committee (PCCC)
item.description: A FEW HOURS LEFT! Google's privacy changes take effect March 1 -- click here to protect yourself: http://t.co/tODxC2Lr #dontbeevil
item.content:encoded: A FEW HOURS LEFT! Google's privacy changes take effect March 1 -- click here to protect yourself: http://t.co/tODxC2Lr #dontbeevil In just a few hours, Google will put into place new privacy policies. Gizmodo reports, "things you could do in relative anonymity today, will be explicitly associated with your name, your face, your phone number come March 1st."  If you don't act today, all your past searches and activity will be retroactively applied. Here's how to change that in less than a minute: 1. Sign into your Google account. 2. Go to https://www.google.com/history (clicking will open in new tab) 3. Click "remove all Web History." 4. Click "ok." Note that removing your Web History also pauses it. Web History will remain off until you enable it again. (Via the EFF under Creative Commons.) 5. Then, sign up on the right to join the fight for Internet freedom. (After you sign up, we'll give you ways to share with your friends.) Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: boldprogressives.org

item.title: Foursquare Dumps Google & Goes Open-Source for Maps
item.description: Foursquare Dumps Google & Goes Open-Source for Maps http://t.co/LKHA70dJ
item.content:encoded: Foursquare Dumps Google & Goes Open-Source for Maps http://t.co/LKHA70dJ Foursquare just made what it called "a little announcement", but it's really not little at all. It's switching away from the Google Maps API to OpenStreetMap. For the map images, it hired MapBox, a start-up that makes pretty maps out of OpenStreetMap data. Starting with foursquare.com, foursquare's maps now use MapBox Streets. Foursquare cites Google's decision to start charging for access to the Google Maps API in October as the reason it started looking for alternatives. But it sounds like it just made more sense to the team philosophically, too. "We love the idea of open data," the announcement says,... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

item.description: See, I was fine reading this until I got to the actual pictures and I almost effing had a heart attack: http://t.co/ctiUEAkq #entomophobia
item.content:encoded: See, I was fine reading this until I got to the actual pictures and I almost effing had a heart attack: http://t.co/ctiUEAkq #entomophobia The insect is so large — as big as a human hand — it's been dubbed a "tree lobster." It was thought to be extinct, but some enterprising entomologists scoured a barren hunk of rock in the middle of the ocean and found surviving Lord Howe Island stick insects. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: The Pirate Bay, Now Without Torrents | TorrentFreak
item.description: The Pirate Bay, Now Without Torrents http://t.co/dyhs23zw
item.content:encoded: The Pirate Bay, Now Without Torrents http://t.co/dyhs23zw Today marks the end of an era for The Pirate Bay. The largest torrent site on the Internet has just removed all popular torrent files and made the switch to magnet links. The Pirate Bay team believes the move is needed to make the site future proof, and is confident that it won't cause much trouble among users. Link - Trackbacks
